intro: Leschenaultia hortii, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to coastal environments. Leschenaultia hortii is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
